page.title: 06Interesting Historic Bldgs.
page.content: Good examples of typical Kentish architecture can be seen in the village. The long steep red-tiled roofs of the nearby weavers cottages used to house their looms. The historic and old beamed Star & Garter hotel was once a monastic house near the tiny chapel of St.Mary, site of the ppresent church. The hotel has recently acquired the neighbouring pub for a restaurant extension. Spyways, next door, with an overhanging front is aptly named being a look-out for smugglers or the arrival of the stagecoach. The large house opposite was a master weavers house, then barracks for troops during the Napoleonic wars, and a coffee tavern. The Rootes Motor Group had it's origins in the basement where William Rootes had a cycle repair shop in 1900. A former oast in the village is the ex- servicemen's club.
